segments.text: I feel a twinge of sadness watching the woman completely unaware of her surroundings.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s as if she’s trapped in her own little world, not realizing the danger brewing behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children’s playful mischief contrasts with her concentration; I wish she could see them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus on the plate makes her blind to the water cascading down the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy leaning further, now with two cookies almost in his grasp.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: If only she would look up; perhaps then the chaos would subside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Watching this unfold, I feel both joy at their innocence and worry at their recklessness.
segments.speaker: PAR
